titles.title: To designate the United States Post Office building located at 201 East Pikes Peak Avenue in Colorado Springs, Colorado, as the "Winfield Scott Stratton Post Office".

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Government Reform and Oversight. Financial Services, Ways and Means, and Government Reform and Oversight, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Postal Service.

committee.name: House Committee on Government Reform and Oversight

action.text: Subcommittee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

committee.name: House Committee on Government Reform and Oversight

action.text: Forwarded by Subcommittee to Full Committee.

committee.name: House Committee on Government Reform and Oversight

action.text: Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

committee.name: House Committee on Government Reform and Oversight

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.

committee.name: House Committee on Government Reform and Oversight

action.text: Mr. McHugh moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate, read twice.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Voice Vote.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

bill.summary: 2/23/1995--Introduced. Designates the U.S. Post Office building located at 201 East Pikes Peak Avenue in Colorado Springs, Colorado, as the Winfield Scott Stratton Post Office.
